intro: [WRONG START] Bulospermum javanicum, commonly known as the Java bulbous orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its bulb-like structures that store nutrients. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white, yellow, and orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
